snippet: It is often called wild yeast — a reference to its natural habitat of fruit skins and to its volatile temperament.
abstract: Brettanomyces, often called wild yeast, reference to its natural habitat of fruit skins and to its volatile temperament, is being used by artisanal beer brewers once again; wild yeast is prized for hints of tropical fruit, earthiness, spiciness and funkiness that it lends to beers; list of beers with distinctive tastes produced by wild yeast.
lead_paragraph: It is often called wild yeast — a reference to its natural habitat of fruit skins and to its volatile temperament.

headline.seo: Brettanomyces, a Funky Yeast, Makes Flavorful Beers
headline.main: Brettanomyces, a Funky Yeast, Makes Flavorful Beers
headline.print_headline: Wild Yeast Yields Beer With a Taste of the Past
